website_summaries.verdict: The best inexpensive option for people on a tight budget. Surprising connectivity for something so inexpensive.
pros: Dual antennas provide decent coverage inside
Best for smaller areas and spaces with few interior walls like bedrooms or apartments
cons: Connectivity is lackluster compared to more expensive ASUS options

customer_reviews.title: Asus Support is REALLY bad
customer_reviews.text: I configured the router and then updated the firmware like they suggested. After the update, the router did not work at all. I called their support. They answered relatively quickly, but the person was both hard to hear and hard to understand. Ultimately, they opened a support ticket because, apparently, the people who actually know what to do don't work when it is convenient for me to call them. Likely to return this router and try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great for most homes or basic small offices
customer_reviews.text: Good basic router for most homes. Supports enough features for most home users, and enough for some power users to get by. Most people are up-sold to a Nighthawk, but that's really overkill. My first one died unexpectedly though. Supports DD-WRT and Tomato, worth Tomato probably being the better alternative. You can also bridge or repeat with this router. I daisy changed a few with acceptable results. Could use more simultaneous bands though. On a cantenna/wok-fi, you SNR is acceptable and will do half a mile or better with a good collector on either side, 1/4 mile only on one side to a router inside a house (through a wall) if you boost the other Tx.
customer_reviews.author: Someone else

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint if your tight on space
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router i got so that i used separate my wifi network i use it to put all my Smart devices on it rather than on my working AP. yes i can use my main router has the 2 bands but i have my reasons as to why i choose to do it this way. This is only for the 2.4 band it does not have the 5 and it works great for what i use it for and is able to cover the whole building. This router's config application is packed full of features for such a small device. i am not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Haynes

customer_reviews.title: works well, easy to follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: When my cable company updated their system my wireless router just was not fast enough anymore. So i decided to try this one since i heard good things about it. It was very easy to set up and the directions were easy to follow. I had it set up in a few minutes which is amazing for me since i am not tech savvy. My laptop has been working better since installing this and the WI-FI seems to reach farther with it. It has the dual antennae so i am sure that helps with the signal since my old one didn't have that. I am happy with this router and glad i bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Beauty Del

customer_reviews.title: Repeater mode fail
customer_reviews.text: I've bough three of these. The first one was DOA. The other two worked fine up until last month. One was bought in March and the other in May. They both randomly disconnect ALL THE TIME. It's super frustrating. I'll be working on something and the signal just goes and it resets itself. It happens to both of them. I've tried to flash them, re-install factory settings, update to latest firmware. NOTHING. I'm pretty computer savy and this is incredibly frustrating. What's the return policy on these? I heard they don't work well as repeaters only AP's? If so, please let me know. I've read that on a couple of message boards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great for a cheap router!
customer_reviews.text: This does everything I need it to do (computer, internet radio, two printers). The only reason I'm not giving in five stars is because it was tricky to install, and the instructions say there's a CD; but there isn't one and it turns out you don't need it anyway. The number to call connected me with with a nice woman who straightened it out for me, but I had already wasted quite a bit of time. All's well that end's well, though! Can't speak to how long it will last, because I haven't had it that long.....but really, I didn't need to spend $100 when this one does the tick.
customer_reviews.author: jimmnpls

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Support as in No Support
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived with an insert "Having Trouble, Call us at...". I called twice and was dropped from the call each time, first within 15 seconds, the second within 45 seconds. Thankfully, one video on Youtube, "ASUS RT-N12 Initial Setup And Config", walked me through the setup. If you're not computer saavy, you'll probably need help as I did. PS I have internet access as part of a cable 'triple play.' Remember, even if the wifi is not working, you can get internet access by running a cable to the modem from your computer. Then, you'll be able to search for online support, video or otherwise. Good luck!!
customer_reviews.author: mickey1

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like ASUS routers so when I needed a repeater for my shop I chose this little router. The setup was easy using the ASUS interface. All was going good until the unit indicated a new firmware update was available. When trying to update the firmware the unit bricked. Got on chat with tech support and was very impressed. They lead me to downloads and websites that cured my unit perfectly. Kudos to ASUS tech support. Router has been functioning as a repeater for 2 weeks now with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great features at lower price
customer_reviews.text: I have used Asus before and the thing I mostly use them for and like about them is the extra stuff it can do, the repeater mode to be exact is often why I buy this brand. Yes other brands have it but normally for a much higher price. Asus offers the features at a reasonable price and the set up is quick and easy. My last one I had for several years before it started having issues, they seem rather long lasting and reliable as well
customer_reviews.author: Henry Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase for WAN multi-site routing needs...
customer_reviews.text: The device was used to handle VOIP data packets, which it did nicely. The problem we experienced was that it would not properly distribute route table traffic. So, we contacted ASUS and both 1st and 2nd level support stated that it was company policy that support was not allowed to provide remote access support to troubleshoot and resolve their router issues . All they could offer was to have me fill out a feed back form so their engineers in 24 to 48 hours, could verify the information being entered by the user. Then what? Was my question that they could not answer...
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth H Wilson Jr

customer_reviews.title: Wrestled WPA password settings a few times over.... I'm done.
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to make this work. Packed it away to try again later twice. Each time I ran into the same issue. I would change the password for each frequency and it would lock me out. I would change one network and keep the other default. The changed network would not connect. No support papers could be found. I'm stumped on such a simple problem and finding out that it isn't as capable as I'd like. Dumping this in the e-waste bin. I'm done tooling with it.
customer_reviews.author: Augie S.

customer_reviews.title: More than Satisfactory in a Pinch!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little router for the money! I purchased it after having made a very hard move. My more deluxe ASUS router was packed in boxes I couldn’t get to. For how cheap this one was, it performed almost as well and got me thru until I could unbox my better one. What I missed were the QOS settings, which prioritized traffic on my slower internet speeds. This router lacks that ability. Also, it’s only 2.4GHz, which also seems to have made a noticeable difference. But, for as inexpensive as it was, it more than admirably performed its duty. I plan to pair it with the better router as a network extender.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good router, bad set-up instructions!
customer_reviews.text: This router is extremely affordable. We were wondering how it would be at such a low price. We've had it for about 3 months now, I think, and it's been great. No problems with operation at all The one trouble I had, as I'm not particularly tech savvy, was set-up. The included "instructions" were almost no help; the start-up program was missing some details as well. I was at a loss on how to link up our TV and tablet until I watched a video featured on amazon explaining more about setting up a wireless router. Without that video I'd probably still be scratching my head!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: RIP after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgrade my modem which can go up to 500 mbps. I get 100 mbps directly from modem but get only 30 mbps via this router for both wifi and wired. According to the specs of this router, it should able to support "up to 300 Mbps". I tried to tweak QoS upload and download bandwidth too 500Mb/s but still getting the same speed. Does anyone ever reach 300 mbps with this router? 10/04/19 Having trouble to get on internet for few days. Today I ran a test and confirmed this router is dead. Unbelievable ASUS's quality is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: H2O

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few weeks now. It was very easy to set up and has good wifi range and good speed. I also like the fact that I can have an app on my ipad and can monitor it and change the settings right from the app. The price was really good and Asus also had a $10 rebate, so total cost with the rebate was under $20. That's a hard price to beat for a really good router. I also bought the extended warranty for 4 years. I've had a lot of problems with different routers, so hope this one holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Hamster

customer_reviews.title: Simple and just works
customer_reviews.text: So far really happy with my choice and I bought it on sale! I replaced 3y old, much more expensive and unstable TP-Link (utter garbage). After more than a month RT-N12 is stable without a single reboot (knock on wood). It comes with modest hardware and 2.4GHz WiFi only, so do not push it too much. I tried flashing DD-WRT, which did not go well. WiFI was unstable and slowed down to crawl. Went back to stock, which is also WRT based, all good.
customer_reviews.author: Jano

customer_reviews.title: it worked great. I have charter internet
customer_reviews.text: I have had this wireless router for about a month. At first, as others have claimed, it worked great. I have charter internet, and was not getting the speed from my old Cisco router. From the start, with the Asus, I was getting 95 mps download speed, way up from my original Cisco. Today I started noticing lag in downloads, and checked download speeds, both wireless and wire through the wireless router. Sitting next to it wirelessly, 15 mps download speed, and wired up to it 25 mps. I've defaulded it back to factory settings, and firmware is up to date. Do not waste your time with this router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The two that I’ve ordered both had issues
customer_reviews.text: I had to send the first one back because it wasn’t more than a fraction of the speed that I should be getting from my modem. I made the mistake of ordering a replacement and now it randomly keeps unsyncing from my modem and causing lost connection. Their tech support is not helpful at all. The guy didn’t even know what was happening and was wasting my time thinking I had a bad ethernet cable and wireless inference.
customer_reviews.author: Dreadflames

customer_reviews.title: Solid router
customer_reviews.text: Using it as a router and it has has a solid signal, and has only need to be reset once in a month. Did have an issue with Xbox One S, where it was giving a moderate or restricted NAT (that's a bad thing when playing multiplayer). Right before I was going to return it I stopped having any problems, so maybe it was an isolated incident. I have not had any issues since. The ASUS has worked better than my old Tp link ac1200 archer c5 which required daily and sometimes hourly resets. Distance is maybe a little better as the tp link, but not much.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup.  So easy, I didn't have to do it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my mom because after 2.5 hours over two days of trying to walk her through a hardware and password reset of her old router by phone, I decided just buying her a new router was preferable. (In her defense, the company's online manual was straight up wrong and 192.168.x.x didn't take you to an admin page). He router arrived while I was at work, so I agreed to call her on my way home to walk her through setting up her new router. When I called, she had already installed and configured security on it. She has 4-5 bars everywhere in her house and I didn't have to do a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G

customer_reviews.title: Low cost wireless router can be used as Access Point.
customer_reviews.text: You have to hook this up as your router to easily change setting to make it an access point. The resume with your regular router, hooking up this to port next to the WAN connection on your router. You will lose one router port but the Access Point will add 4 more. Open your router page and use the LAN settings to give the Access Point an IP in the router's range of IP's. Click on Apply on the LAN page. Save the setup and Reboot your router to make it ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: JohnG

customer_reviews.title: Wish it didn't occasionally lose its configuration
customer_reviews.text: This router worked fine for me for quite a while, but in the last couple months it seems to have developed a problem where it forgets its configuration and goes back to factory defaults. This was a major hassle the first time it happened as I didn't have a config backup, but after I got it up and working properly again I saved the config so I can restore it again whenever this happens. In the last three months I've had it lose its config three times, without any apparent reason for it happening. Thank goodness for backups. Because of this problem, I can't recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I don't like ordering something and finding the features on the product ...
customer_reviews.text: According to Amazon web site, "Instantly Switch Modes Thanks to the Software EZ switch on the back of the router, quickly." There is no switch on the router I received. I don't like ordering something and finding the features on the product are not as advertised so I sent it back. Picture is from the routers manual which is NOT included with the router. I thought this picture was also on the website but I don't see it now.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Prohs

customer_reviews.title: Poorest Reception of Any Wireless Router in 10 Years
customer_reviews.text: Poorest range of any router I've used in our house over 10 years, including the built-in wireless that comes with AT&Ts DSL modems. I moved it out of the basement (where all the other routers have suffered their fate) and stuck it in the living room and I STILL have dead spots I've never had before. I'm surprised. I love ASUS stuff. Then again, I paid under $30 so what did I expect? I think I'll send it back and upgrade or just chalk it up to experience and plug the equally cheap TP-LINK that seems to do better with its smaller antennas.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and functional
customer_reviews.text: I've installed several Asus routers and particularly appreciate the user interface this unit shares with the others. This is not the company's most feature-laden product, but it has more than enough "power" to support an amateur radio digital repeater in 24/7 service with constant date movement. We have noted that the operating system in this unit has a Linux core, which can be accessed for special purposes. It is a very good performer and an amazing bargain for its modest price.
customer_reviews.author: PR

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the price, or any price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this router after getting fed up with how my TP link WR841N router would not work well with my chromecasts and security cameras. They would constantly lose their connection with the TP link, no matter how much I tweaked the router settings. Chromecasts, security cameras, phones, and computers all work perfectly with this Asus router. Don't spend 5-10 times more on another router, this one will work just as well!
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: took me about 5 minutes to do the whole setup thing, including updating the firmware.
customer_reviews.text: EASY SETUP - took me about 5 minutes to do the whole setup thing, including updating the firmware. put router together. unplug modem. hook the modem up to the router with the cable provided. plug modem and router into outlet. wait about a minute for the lights on the modem and on the router to go solid. ('ASUS' wifi network should pop up) connect to it. use your phone(i did at least) an open your browser. setup screen automatically pops up. blah blah blah. the rest should be a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: MiKEY

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: Very slow. Im getting 50mbps when it should be 200 up and down. I checked its definitely not my isp. When im directly hard wired to my pc from a modem im getting 200mbps, but this router gives 1/4th. I buy asus stuff all the time, never had any issues. I didn't think i would be getting these figures if i go for a cheap router as it states it can support up to 300mbps. Perhaps 300 is possible on 1tb line. But its definitely a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Twice the speed of my old one.
customer_reviews.text: I am cutting the cord, and I needed to upgrade my wireless router. I am very happy so far with this one. The setup was easy, the range is good, and I doubled the download speed of my wireless connections. I have Fire Sticks on two tvs, and am able to stream the Directv Now app on both of them at the same time with no problems. As a bonus I got the $10 rebate from Asus, which brought the price down to $20. I haven't set up a guest network yet, but I like the versatility of this router. If any problems develop, I'll be sure to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Phil

customer_reviews.title: I rolled the dice and they came up snake eyes
customer_reviews.text: Arrived defective. Tried twice on two separate days to try and make it work, and was on the phone with ASUS customer service for 45 minutes, who could barely hear me in their call center so I had to yell into the phone slowly for him to understand. The issue is that the WAN port on the back is defective - it doesn't receive the signal from my modem, nor would that light won't turn on, even after multiple resets of each device and using different cables. You get what you pay for I suppose. For the price it's possibly worth a gamble, but I rolled the dice and came up snake eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: signal strength at 10' -53db 50mBs dL. very good, at 25' one door drops to -73db 15mBs very bad (NO RANGE), Can't access configure page after setup, SSID name same as I set, won't accept my password; 30-30-30 reset/hard reset still NO access to 192.168.1.1. Customer support (as many others have said) horrible!!! Should have been transferred to technician, instead rep. keep posting pre-scripped information, did not even know what a 30-30-30 reset is. Bought used NETGEAR AC1200 for $19; works great! Don't buy Asus C/S a joke!!!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: It lasted 9 months - then i went back to April 2018 Firmware.....
customer_reviews.text: It is as described. I had 3 older re-purposed desktops for physically connected Nas machines and 2 64bit Windows machines as wireless clients. This evening the device seemed to stop broadcasting or responding. to any attempts to reconfigure. Edited: Loaded the Firmware I believe was on it April 2018 at purchase..... the router is "working" for 2 days now.....
customer_reviews.author: Cyberben

customer_reviews.title: Basic and to the point
customer_reviews.text: Got this for use at an apartment I use for work purposes (my main residence as Ubiquiti gear), and it fits the bill: cheap, basic, to the point. To reiterate what others have said, it's a basic 802.11b/g/n unit, which for you non-techies are the older (and slower) wi-fi standards, albeit with better range in some cases. With four ethernet ports and decent wifi to boot, I don't think you can go wrong for how cheap it is.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Blaze

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as an access point. WiFi signals aren't great for you, so I like to turn off my wifi when i'm not using it. I turned off the wireless on my primary router, leave it on b/c my security cameras are linked to it (wired cameras). I have an ethernet cable going from it to this router, which I can easily turn off by pressing the power button. Btw...Google "Kids experiment effects of wifi on fruit". As far as performance goes, I stream 80% of the time+I haven't had 1 issue. I wold def buy again!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup as extender/access point
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a more reliable range extender for home WIFI than the TPLink plug-in version I had. I originally set this up as a range extender and it seemed to work fine. Tested connection speed and then used a TPLink powerline adapter to hardwire and make an access point. The connection speed was significantly better (as suggested by online articles). After several days, it has been very reliable and strong. I used same network name as FIOS router and it has worked fine. Good price for this unit in any configuration. I also found the setup rather simple to follow, although I see some have commented on challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Matt & MB

customer_reviews.title: If you need a disposable router its okay..
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine January 2018. By January 2019 the wifi portion started failing giving me very low bandwidth in every device tested (about 10). The hardwired devices, no problem, maintained 50 mbs, wireless devices no matter the distance within range was about .8 to 2 mbs. The router was in a ventilated area and protected and kept away from other devices, but I've had to already buy a new router, and its not going to be Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman A. Stebbins

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended to me by a fellow IT Tech. But, never in my wildest imagination, I was going to believe the power behind it. It can route, AP, and provide up to 3 SSDs. Packed with a 2.4Ghz this device will be the best you can get for the money. Asus has done and this product will literally surprise you by the capabilities. Please don't forget about the guest network with a time of usage for each user. Just incredible equipment!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Paez

customer_reviews.title: Delivered wrong product creating misery to configure as an access point!
customer_reviews.text: \ Like other reviewers I was sent the wrong product- it did not have the switches for mode of operation. The manual was perfectly unclear on how to get the beast to operate in Access Point Mode. I figured it out. I installed it on my network. It was great. Then I updated the firmware! And I was back to point zero. Couldn't get the beast configured again. Don't buy this as anything but a router connected to your modem unless you have knowledge and patience.
customer_reviews.author: Ken from Illinois

customer_reviews.title: It's about what you like!
customer_reviews.text: It works for me. I like Asus interface. I have two of their routers higher end and this one. Higher end more features but they both work well, for me.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: A low end router that works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this same exact router for years and I decided to buy a new version of it simply because my other one was about 5 years old. This is far from being a high end router and the signal isn't that great, but it's perfect for a person who lives in a small apartment like myself. Highly recommended for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JJ17

customer_reviews.title: Great Value. OK Performance
customer_reviews.text: Had mine for a few weeks now. One of the cleaner UIs for configuration I've seen on a router. Very nice surprise. Seems to do everything well and has a tad better range than my previous 2 routers. Wireless speeds are good. The only thing it does not excel in is network routing and data transfer. I have a NAS and run a plex media server. On occasions accessing shared network folders and data transfer bog the router down worse than my previous one. Plex still runs fine though for internal and external users. Overall great value router. Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Grizzle

customer_reviews.title: Returned for faster router
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be of solid construction. Did not operate at speeds listed despite troubleshooting with ASUS. My speed was 92mbps/96mbps when connected via broaband, just shy of the 100mbps advertised by my ISP. Speed never exceeded 40mbps for download or upload when connected wirelessly. I returned for a dual bandwidth (this only offers 2.4ghz) Netgear AC1000. It was delivered in two hours with prime now and I now have speeds that reflect plan offered by my ISP.
customer_reviews.author: prime obssessed

customer_reviews.title: FALSE DOUBLE LINKED REBATE FORM.  $10 ONLY.  NOT $20
customer_reviews.text: The product is GREAT an RT-N12 D1 router like I wanted. I put Tomato firmware on it and it runs great. The problem is that Amazon is linking twice to the same rebate form. Linking twice to the same $10 rebate form, that is limited to "1 per household" will NOT give the consumer $20. You will only get $10. I notified Amazon of this near the beginning of October 7 2017 and they are still double linking to the rebate form. I expect a better business practice. Fix the false advertising, so I can rate just the router.
customer_reviews.author: Sandhiller

customer_reviews.title: Great setup, strong signal
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our church. Setup was incredible, just plug it in, connect your cable modem and your laptop and a setup menu appears! Good coverage through concrete block walls. This replaced an older Netgear wireless router and has much better signal strength. Very pleased with my purchase as is our pastor.
customer_reviews.author: WNCChip

customer_reviews.title: Other modes do not work
customer_reviews.text: The router does not work when set in access point mode. It transmits an SSID that was on my network before. No matter how many time I "factory reset" it, it still sends out the ransom ssid. I will do a reset and change the password, then it will not let me in. If it was once or twice I would figure I just typo'ed it. But after like the 6th time I am sure it is the router. It worked fine in regular router mode but extended or access point cause it problems. Go figure just a couple days past the return date. I have two degrees in networking and IT. This is not an operator error.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V

customer_reviews.title: Works with my smart TV.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, runs 4 loads at the same time while streaming Roku tv and saves me $5 a month by not renting one.
customer_reviews.author: MR X

customer_reviews.title: Changing the router channel is a MUST!
customer_reviews.text: The set up on this router was easier and quicker than any other. A few days after I got it working the connection dropped to 1-2mbps. I tried lots of things to get the connection higher and it turns out all I had to do was change the router channel. This is done by logging into the router on your PC. It will suggest a channel with low interference, this made all the difference and the router has had no problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Hillam Family

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality, hasn't even lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for 11 months and it was good at first. It decreases my speeds from 60 Mbps (from the modem) to about 30 when sitting right next to it. In my room, same level, through two walls and about 20 feet away, it loses connection repeatedly. These issues started after about 6 months. I would not recommend this router. I have had other budget routers that last a year even with speed reduction issues
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Repeater function doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: THis unit is going back, bought it because I have a ASUS wifi modem and wanted it as an extender, spent tons of hours trying to make it work, with no luck. There is no easy switch as advertised and the instruction manual is useless. Cheap construction, when finally got to connect to the thing via router.asus.com I do the administrator use as extender and the thing cannot connect to my other wifi router. Don't waste your time and money not worth it, was a lightning deal that I regret.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Sotres

customer_reviews.title: Good enough entry level router.
customer_reviews.text: A pretty decent low-end budget router, fine if you don't need anything fancy or long-range, however, the signal strength could be better, but I didn't ding it a star because, hey, at this price point, I wasn't expecting a leviathan of a router. I added a set of 9 dBi antennas and that made a noticeable difference in the signal strength. I've mainly used Linksys routers in the past, this is my first experience with an Asus router, and I really like its web interface. Easily configured from either a laptop or also easily navigable from my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: philz

customer_reviews.title: but it's past the warranty return window so I basically just wasted $30. Not a huge amount of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router at the beginning of January 2018 and it is already failing. Even the wired connection through the router is ~70mbps slower than when directly connected to modem. Wireless connection is even slower than that of course. Not sure if it was defective, but it's past the warranty return window so I basically just wasted $30. Not a huge amount of money, but I would/should have rather spent more initially.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: RIP, dead in 4mo
customer_reviews.text: almost 4mo to the day i ordered it, it stopped working. ive been using it in AP mode flawlessly for months now and then we woke up one day and nothing connected to that AP was connecting to the internet. Chromecast, several google home units and a roku stick all became useless. i've yet to contact support but i dont have much faith after the reviews ive seen here. RIP Asus
customer_reviews.author: Kenobi

customer_reviews.title: I'm VERY happy!
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy setup. Replaced another manufacturer's router that I was unhappy with (kept dropping the signal or degrading it). Quick and easy to update the firmware and finalize the configuration. Was able to boost my Wi-Fi signal to the FULL maximum bandwidth my ISP provides (50Mbps) even though the router is on the other side of the house from my office. Previously was getting ~30Mbps. Now perfectly strong signal and maximum throughput!
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: Wrong equipment sent
customer_reviews.text: Like the reviewer in late May, I was also sent the wrong equipment. Mine also lacks the ez switch (despite it being touted on the box) and only has the WAN button. It can be set as a router/repeater/AP during the setup, but repeated mode does not work. It throws an error that the parent AP is not connected when browsing, but says the connection is fine in the router dashboard. Not sure what's going on, but I'll be calling ASUS tomorrow and update my review. Edit - ASUS were little help. Initiated return with Amazon. Will look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good stuff. I've used it for a long time. Not any issues. But I don't know how to discuss it. I just want to clean up the review. Because when I look at the review which hasn't reviewed that I will feel uncomfortable. That's it.
customer_reviews.author: Yima

customer_reviews.title: so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: working great so far. arrived today and i set it up today. port forwarding is not working now, i don't know why. i believe settings are the same as linksys that this replaced. looks very nice. i like the linksys but there was another issue on my network that made me think i should use something different. it looks nice, price was very affordable for a router, especially a new one. will update if i figure out port-forwarding. important because my security cameras go through this system. otherwise i like it, i believe the administration is a little bit simpler and more intuitive than the linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this on Prime day just to use as a secondary router for my home. Advertised to get up to 300 Mbps. Well I have an internet plan running 280 mbps with all cat-5e and 6 wires to multiple devices in the house and this piece of plastic barely pushed 100mbps and the WiFi is terrible. 36mbps max if you’re lucky. My Netgear WiFi is running over 200 mbps easy by itself in the other room as the primary. Stay away from this deal
customer_reviews.author: Khully

customer_reviews.title: Speeds less than 1Mbps
customer_reviews.text: I set this up as a wireless access point to use to extend my network. I tried to set it up multiple times and could never get more than .25 mpbs speeds standing in the same room. My download speeds from my main router are 100 Mbps. This is just not worth the money or effort.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Improves with age
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same model 15 years ago. I used it it as an AP. It was great back then, and has served me well. Lately, it became flaky - needing daily or more frequent reboots. So I bought a replacement. Coincidently, I also needed a new NAS backup unit. I've just finished a 36 hour data transfer from the old drive to the new without one hiccup from the modem. It not be the smartest and fastest, but its highly reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works where others wouldn’t
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced another Brands Router that was less than a few months old and designed for outside use. For the best coverage This new Router has to be inside my shed, where the old unit was. It appears so far that this Router can handle the Temperatures that are inside the shed better than the old one. Only Time will tell, I will update this revue if I experience a Failure.
customer_reviews.author: ERNEST ALLEN THEISS

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. The signal is a little weak in certain parts of my house and I definitely don't get wifi outside of my house. It is set up in the basement so it could be a reflection of the location. Either way I am happy with the product. The price was great.
customer_reviews.author: Cooder

customer_reviews.title: Directions stink, but You Tube shows you how to use it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to use as a repeater. It helps boost my network signal to an outbuilding near my house. Works good enough that it will stream the internet and I can see Netflix! This is far better than subscribing to an additional service. It was easy to hook up as far as just plugging it into the wall. The directions are not very thorough, though, so I got on You Tube to see how you use it with an existing network and make it be a repeater rather than a router. You need to select the function you want to use with this box and I was a little confused about that.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: False advertising!
customer_reviews.text: This a very good router but it was sold as a 3-In-1 which it is not . I would not have ordered this simply as a router because, I really needed it in repeater mode. Fortunately, I was able to use it in another area and save the hassle of return. I will order a repeater, as that is what I still need, BUT NOT FROM THIS SELLER, as I feel this practice is deceptive and borderline fraud!
customer_reviews.author: Joycelyn M. Mire

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router and Access Point
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router. I have had absolutely NO issues. I have used this both as a router at my office and as a access point in my home. I have had other routers and access point brands that I have had to repeatedly reboot because of lost internet signals. With this baby I never need to reboot it. Always works flawlessly. I would highly recommend for basic home and business use.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: These are great routers for running Tomato Shibby
customer_reviews.text: These are great routers for running Tomato Shibby. I use these for access points and as wireless clients. They seem to be stable and quite customizable using this firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: using a couple of these as extenders, they work ...
customer_reviews.text: using a couple of these as extenders, they work well for simple light duty surfing. The newest software wont let you keep the same SSID of the network your extending which makes a mess of your available networks list, but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Took about 10 minutes to configure as an access point on the bridged network to the interior of my steel machine shed. I use this router/access point for remote control of building access, cameras, and lighting.
customer_reviews.author: solidwood

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Vizio router I got about a year ago that was total crap. So far this Asus RT-N12 appears to be a great product. Reliable, fast, stable. No complaints. -- Their rebate think is terrible. Nobody can get that $10 back. They will claim many things to not give you those $10 and honestly I'll rethink about buying Asus again just because of that!
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, the only issue I had was that it requires a PC/Mac to do the initial config plugged in through the Lan port. All of my devices are wifi so it took me a couple of days to get going, had to borrow a laptop to config. So keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: K. S. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Great basic WiFi router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to supplement / replace the inbuilt WiFi router supplied by my ISP. It works great, provides a strong signal in my small house, and has been bulletproof a year and a half, so far. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tintin

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long. Buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router about 16 months ago, and am using it as an AP. It worked fine and had decent range for a while, but the past week or so the signal has been cutting out multiple times a day, or dropping to unusable speeds. Really disappointed in the longevity of this one. And of course, ASUS support is just not worth the hassle to get a replacement. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: No performance
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. Horrible connection rate as compared to others. I should be getting 113 and only get 34-41. I tried a different model that was a little more and it was where it should be as in speed. Don’t by, it’s junk.
customer_reviews.author: August

customer_reviews.title: The seller is great, the product has a better interface than netgear
customer_reviews.text: The seller is great, the product has a better interface than netgear, and the performance is great from the antennas, but I'm still looking for a user interface that is flexible with bridging and routing, and also offers tools for vpn, parental controls, etc. The problem with netgear is that it takes so dang long to configure because of the constant need to apply the settings. The Asus interface is much smoother and faster than netgear, but it is not as flexible in the sense of routing. That being said, if all you want is a home router with good range from the antennas, this is an all around winner for the dollars spent.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaOmegaBroadbandLLC

customer_reviews.title: Bought several of these, works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for single systems just to prevent hacking. Nothing special, one computer per router to block all ports but the ones I wanted to pass through. They work great. Great feature set, and are damn reliable. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: AudioCraZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friends house because I was tired of not having WiFi reception in their basement. This router more than doubled their WiFi coverage and I was finally able to work in the basement. The router also increased their internet speed by about 10 Mbps. If you haven't updated your router in the last 10 years its time to upgrade!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Router works well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these routers to replace some old Linksys routers that I have had for probably 10 years or more. The setup is relatively straightforward. I have one configured as a router, and the other as a repeater on my second floor. These routers have been running for over two months now and have not required a restart. Also, my internet speeds are way faster now, although that is probably more of a symptom of my Linksys routers being really old, but I have not seen a drop in speed over the several months of use. I am very pleased, and the price was right, especially with the $10 rebate.
customer_reviews.author: frinky77

customer_reviews.title: Working as it should...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first WiFi installation and it has been performing well for six months. I have a slow DSL phone line to my house, but this router does a good job connecting my computer, laptop and television. I can't stream movies because of the slow DSL, but the router allows all my devices internet access for email, browsing and google assist. I was able to get it set up with minimal confusion.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Ammon

customer_reviews.title: For $30, this thing should have a dozen stars.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a quick replacement when my previous wireless router broke. The one it replaced was a "good one", by which I mean it was expensive, in the $200 range. I needed one in a hurry, and finances were somewhat tight at the time, so I got this one, figuring I'd have time later to make a really informed purchase. This one has been so much better than the vastly more expensive one it replaced. The song and dance of resetting the router every week is over. Honestly, it's the best wireless router I've ever owned... and $30.
customer_reviews.author: S. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Small. Works well. No 5.0GHz
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Replaced my other router that needed reset constantly. Speed is just as good as other routers. Very small and compact. Easy to use. Well worth what I paid Wish it had 5.0GHz setting though.
customer_reviews.author: SteveB

customer_reviews.title: It'll do in a small space.
customer_reviews.text: Decent wireless modem. Not the highest speed, but in a smaller space, it will get the job done. Used for a little over a month now without a hiccup. Build quality of the product is a tad questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrold

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: No problems with the router. Nothing worth writing home about, but it's cheap and functional. Good enough for a small office, but the gaming crowd will probably want to invest in something more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Batman_Bin_SuparmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Perfect router for a modern home network.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a two year old Linksys that was having issues with the ISP I use and the number of devices we use in my home. This router installed in less than 20 minutes in the same network and has had no problems at all. I did have an issue with the first time I tried setting up the network security settings but I later found out it was caused by an older network adapter driver on the laptop I was doing the set up on. Its been more than a month with this router and i haven't had to power cycle it once. I am extremely happy with this Asus product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad signal range only 2.4ghz
customer_reviews.text: Was going to use this as a wifi extended with my AC 1600. I put this router in the next room and when the power goes out it doesn't pick up the signal from my main router would not recommend this router as your main or as an extender
customer_reviews.author: Luis Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works great as per my sister and it's almost a year ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister who just needs a basic set up at home for lap top and an iPad mini. Works great as per my sister and it's almost a year since she installed it and still works well. Great price for someone who only needs a basic set up. BTW, it still streams Netflix smoothly and without interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: Amaze

customer_reviews.title: Not very good.
customer_reviews.text: Our WiFi went super slow with this. I thought it was our internet so I called our internet company for 2 weeks and they monitored our connection and we were getting 1/3 of the speed showing up on there end. We couldn’t watch Netflix or play games. We bought a new router and have had 0 issues with our internet.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Router was broken when it arrived. Took me a few days of troubleshooting to figure this out. 100% broken when it arrived. If this is replaced free of charge, and the new one works, I'll change this review.
customer_reviews.author: pp

customer_reviews.title: Not the best range
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent router for what it costs. The range on this unit is not very good though. With minimal environmental interference I get about 30-40 feet away and it drops the signal. Make sure you update the firmware when you receive the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile wireless router at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router for the money. I have three all serving different purposes. One is a straight wireless access point and router. Another is used as ethernet connected access point. The third I flashed with DD-WRT for use as an ethernet connected access point but with power control. All work great. A couple have been in service a couple of years with no faults.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: Simply put - you will not find a better router for this price. Replaced an old router not up to the task with the N300 and all my problems went away. The web interface is robust and simple to use for things like port forwarding etc. The manual is a little lacking just use admin/admin for username and password (default) to configure to your liking with any browser.
customer_reviews.author: Hacon Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Bait N300 Switch!
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned ASUS is using new boxes for an older model and missing the EZ switch. I didn’t notice until well after the return period. Not only that it’s not that good because I’m only in an 800 sq ft unit and the connection drops.
customer_reviews.author: It'sonlyme

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: This router was very easy to set up for me, I am a person with no real technical skill. So far it is working great, and was a lot more affordable most other routers.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for awhile then suddenly stopped supporting WAN traffic
customer_reviews.text: This router was easy to set up and worked reliably and then after about a year or so, despite never logging into it as admin after the initial configuration, it suddenly allowed zero traffic in or out of it’s WAN port. Devices connected on the LAN side either by cable or wirelessly could talk to each other by not a bit could get out to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: pbsean

customer_reviews.title: Drop uour cable box fee this is great!
customer_reviews.text: This was sooooo easy to set up. I was so worried dropping the comcast box and adding a router and modem would be difficult but this was super quick. Instructions oncluded were perfect. .... The worst part was being mad for not doing it sooner the wifi is wayyyy faster than what the comcast box gave us and we paid a mothly fee to use the dumb thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie R.

customer_reviews.title: The QoS options are awesome, especially after updating the framework
customer_reviews.text: Not a single complaint other than that it occasionally kicks me off the router, not letting me reconnect for around 20 seconds. I don't lose connection to the internet really - it's just that the router repeatedly refuses to let me connect to it during this time. It can happen in quick succession plus I have the setting for Network Key Rotation Interval set to never and so I'm quite certain that particular setting is not the culprit. The QoS options are awesome, especially after updating the framework. It allows me to directly limit the bandwidth of each device on the network, setting a max download and upload rate for each device.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R Waters

customer_reviews.title: decent as a cheap router, fails as bridge/extender
customer_reviews.text: Decent router, although the forced 'quick setup' is rather aggravating. It gets 4 star purely as a cheapo router. I purchased it specifically for the functionality of extending/bridging a network and it is terrible at that. It takes forever to acquire host network and couldn't get the DHCP IP address assignment to traverse the bridging/extension. and it offers very little option to configure in those modes.
customer_reviews.author: juice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use, very versatile.
customer_reviews.text: I've used several of these units for different situations. For instance, I used one for a month, while I was between, wideband providers, as a wireless repeater, grabbing my cellphone hotspot wireless signal and repeating it all over the house. My cellphone data usage was 75GB that month, but I have an unlimited data plan. We used the signal for web surfing, video streaming on two TVs (simultaneously), etc. I have also used it as a wireless router, and also as a wired network extender. Truly a great product if you need flexibility!!!
customer_reviews.author: gbs

customer_reviews.title: Kicks Asus
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid router for the money. The software is robust enough for my wireless Arlo security cameras. Coverage is better than expected in my 2k+ square foot warehouse. If i only purchased a couple weeks sooner, this $28 router would have only been $18 with a $10 mail in rebate.
customer_reviews.author: Father of Twins

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive performer
customer_reviews.text: Great little router. Inexpensive and low power. Especially like ASUS's user interface. Used in a remote solar powered installation. Just right.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, bought it to use as a repeater to go with my main router to get a wifi signal to my basement to run a security camera DO NOT buy those standalone wall plugin repeaters btw they are garbage (I made this mistake and had to send it back), you will get much better results by buying a router and set it to repeater mode instead
customer_reviews.author: Nite

customer_reviews.title: The router itself seems good, though the UI is a little clunky
customer_reviews.text: Update: Never realized until now (12/2019) that the ports are 100Mbps, not gigabit. My folks got upgraded by Comcast to 200Mbps and have now outgrown the router, time to look for a new one. ------------ Got a replacement router for my folk's house, they were previously on a 8 or 10 year old Belkin Wireless G basic model. The router itself seems good, though the UI is a little clunky. I haven't really gone deep into the menu options yet as I didn't need to.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

product_meta.title: ASUS RT-N12 N300 WiFi Router 2T2R MIMO Technology, 4K HD Video Streaming, VoIP,Up to 300 Mbps,Black
product_meta.description:
The RT-N12 D1 Wireless-N300 router delivers reliable and fast speeds on both wired and wireless network connections for your home or office environment. With 2T2R MIMO technology and two detachable 5dBi high-gain antennas, the RT-N12 uses the latest antenna innovation for extended wireless coverage range, making it ideal for streaming HD video, placing VoIP calls, and other essential Internet tasks. At a Glance Multiple 3-in-1 router, access point, and range extender modes for ultimate versatility Two detachable 5dBi antennas for wider, more reliable coverage4 SSIDs help manage bandwidth allocation and access control Powerful online multitasking at up to 30, 000 data sessions Features Enhanced Signal Range The RT-N12 specializes in delivering exceptional signal range for speed and reliability on the wireless network. Advanced High Power technology from ASUS enhances signal strength for almost double the range of other routers. Multiple Account Control and Customization Setup and customize up to four wireless networking accounts. Privacy control for each user account restricts access to specified Web sites, and lets you set a limit for the maximum amount of bandwidth each account can use. Easy Setup With the RT-N12, setup is a breeze. Simply power and connect the router and open a browser on a Wi-Fi-enabled device like a notebook or pad. You will then be taken to a setup page with a prompt to enter the ID/password from your internet provider, and that’ s it! Setting up your network is now easier than ever. Instantly Switch Modes Thanks to the Software EZ switch on the back of the router, quickly and easily switch between router, repeater and access point (AP) modes. You can also switch modes using the ASUSWRT graphical user interface straight from your browser. No delays and no hassles – whatever your situation, take your pick and get connected. What's in the BoxRT-N12 D1 Wireless-N300 RouterRJ-45 Cable2 x 5dbi Antennas Card Power Supply Specifications Network Standard dIEEE 802. 11b, IEEE 802. 11g, IEEE 802. 11n, IEEE 802. 3, IEEE 802. 3u, IPv4, IPv6Product SegmentN300 complete networking; 300MbpsData Rate802. 11b : 1, 2, 5. 5, 11Mbps802. 11g : 6, 9, 12, 18, 24, 36, 48, 54Mbps802. 11n : Up to 300MbpsAntennaDetachable 5 dBi antenna x 2* Antenna type will differ according to local regulations and requirement in each country Operating Frequency2. 4GHzEncryption64-bit WEP, 128-bit WEP, WPA2-PSK, WPA-PSK, WPA-Enterprise, WPA2-Enterprise, WPS support Management UPnP, IGMP v1/v2/v3, DNS Proxy, NTP Client, DDNS, Port Triger, Virtual Server, DMZVPN Support IPsec Pass-Throughput Pass-ThroughL2TP Pass-Throughput serverPorts1 x RJ45 for 10/100 BaseT for WAN, 4 x RJ45 for 10/100 BaseT for LAN Button WPS Button, Power Button LED Indicator PWR x 1AIR x 1WAN x 1LAN x 4Power Supply AC Input : 110V~240V(50~60Hz)DC Output : 12 V with max. 0. 5 A currentDimensions11. 1 x 7. 7 x 3. 1 inch (WxDxH)Weight1. 37 ib

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Multiple 3-in-1 Router/Access Point /Range Extender wireless modes
4 SSIDs help manage bandwidth allocation and access control
Powerful Online Multi-tasking, throughput up to 300Mbps
Two detachable 5dBi antennas for more powerful and wider coverage
